thread.title: Air Quality Returns to Normal Level in the South of ThailandTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Air Quality Returns to Normal Level in the South of ThailandTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Air Quality Returns to Normal Level in the South of ThailandTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Air Quality Returns to Normal Level in the South of Thailand Published on : Monday, October 12, 2015
Air quality in Phuket and a number of other provinces in South Thailand has improved and is now return to the normal or well below the limit set for public safety standards, according to Thailandâ€™s Pollution Control Department.
As of October 10, particulate matter in Surat Thani, Songkhla, Satun, Yala, Pattani, Narathiwat, and Phuket is between 21 and 66 microgrammes per cubic metre of air. In Phuket specifically, the level has sharply decreased to 21 microgrammes per cubic metre.
Tourist attractions
The Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) Phuket Office has reported that hotels in Phuket are operating as normal. Likewise, all tourist activities, including tours to Ko Phi Phi and Phang-nga Bay, are operating as normal. All events and festivals remain as scheduled; such as, the Vegetarian Festival nationwide from 13-21 October, 2015.
Transportation
For air travel, all international airports in the South are operating normally. All other modes of transportation, including rail, road and water transport are also operating normally.
Source:- Tourism Authority of Thailand
